questions.stem: The following family health unit provides all of the following services except:
options: Treatment of upper respiratory tract infection.

questions.stem: You are reading an article about the common presentations at the family medicine outpatient clinic and found that one of the commonest presentation is:
When you discuss with this patient weight management you are fulfilling which of the following family physician core competency?
Why are you going to refer him for tertiary care?
options: To Endocrinologist to manage his high blood sugar.
To Internist for follow up of his condition.
To ophthalmologist to screen for retinal changes.
To Emergency to manage diabetic coma.

questions.stem: Referring this patient to an ophthalmologist for screening for diabetic retinopathy is considered what type of referral?

You are working in a family medicine clinic and found that one of your colleagues refer all diabetic patients to endocrinologist with unjustified referral for transferring patient’s responsibility. You will tell him:
options: Keep doing this for the sake of the patient.
Referral is sharing and not transferring responsibility.
Referral is ok so long you didn’t exceed 30% of your patients.

questions.stem: You are assessing the physical growth of a 2-months-old boy. The main parameter of assessment is:

A 6-month-old girl is brought to the family medicine clinic by her mother for common cold. The mother is asking you about the developmental milestones that should be attained by the child at this age. You told her that she can
A mother of a 12-month-old boy is asking you about the ideal weight for her child...What are you going to tell her?
options: His weight is within normal no need to worry.
He is now below the expected and need further assessment.
He needs immediate referral to pediatrician.
He needs immediate abdominal US and CT scan.

questions.stem: A mother brings her 3 years old daughter for regular check up...How are you going to confirm her condition?
options: She is obese based on the weight growth charts.
Calculate her BMI and if > 30, she is obese.
Calculate her BMI and plot it on appropriate curves.

questions.stem: This is the height growth chart of a 16-year-old boy. What is the most common cause of this condition?
options: Chromosomal abnormality e.g., down & turner syndrome

questions.stem: When should screening for hearing problems start at PHC?
Which of the following test will you use?
A 6-month-old boy is presenting with his mother for immunization...According to AAP he should be screened for anemia at the age of:
The mother of a 2-month-old baby ask you about vitamins...What will be your answer ?
options: vitamin D supplementation of 400 IU daily is recommended for infants who are breast fed
iron supplementation is recommended because breast milk has less iron than formula
no supplementation of any sort is needed for breastfed infants until 1 year of age

questions.stem: The mother of a 7-year-old boy is presenting to you asking about the recommended physical activity for her child. You told her that moderate intensity is recommended daily for:
you started taking psychosocial history by asking about HEADSSS. D represents which of the following?
You are screening an adolescent for pre-sports participation. He should be screened for all of the following Except:
regarding the food guide pyramid, he should receive daily 6 servings of:
options: Dairy products as milk and yogurt.

questions.stem: asking you about her due vaccine for this age group. You will recommend for her:
What is the most appropriate next step in the management of this couple?
options: No further action is needed since they are asymptomatic
Advise them to cancel this marriage
Refer them for genetic counselling and carrier screening
Recommend routine premarital blood tests only

questions.stem: What is the dose of folic acid that is recommended for her in this pregnancy to prevent recurrence of this condition?
What is the screening test she should do in her first trimester?
Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient?
options: Do a fasting blood glucose level.

questions.stem: When should she have her blood pressure measured?
What will you ask her to do?
A 3-days-old boy is presenting to you with his mother with the following lesion. What is your management?
options: Squeeze the nipple to release any milk
Patch the nipple to prevent milk secretion
Reassurance the condition is self limited

questions.stem: What is the most appropriate first-line management?
What would you prescribe for her?
options: Doxycycline 100 mg daily with benzoyl peroxide cream
Amoxicillin-clavulanic acid 625 mg twice per day

questions.stem: How are you going to treat this patient?
options: Reassurance and explanation that this is normal

questions.stem: Regardless of her family history, when should Mrs. Magda starts her screening for cancer breast:
What other screening strategies are used for colorectal cancer other than fecal occult blood?
A 21 years old male is concerned about colorectal cancer and wishes to screen for it. He has no risk factor for colorectal cancer, what would you tell him?
options: You can start screening at 50 years.
You can start screening at 55 years.
You can start screening at 60 years.
You can start screening at 45 years.

questions.stem: Mr. Ali is concerned about his father's health. He asks about when he should give his father the pneumococcal vaccine?
You asked Mr. Salah to do the clock-drawing test. His result as shown in the picture refers to abnormality in his?
A 68-year-old white woman presents complaining of low back pain for exactly 2 weeks after a minimal fall...which of the following may be the cause of this back pain?
A 45-year-old patient presents with new onset back pain along with saddle anaesthesia and recent onset of urinary retention. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the name of this test:
A 42 years old male, presents with a 6-week history of persistent sadness...Which of the following best confirms the diagnosis of major depressive disorder?
options: Presence of low mood and anhedonia for at least 1 week.
Presence of low mood and anhedonia for at least 2 weeks, with functional impairment.
Presence of fatigue and poor concentration for at least 4 weeks.
Presence of low mood, anhedonia, and hallucinations for 2 days.

questions.stem: Which tool is used to diagnose depression in older adults?
You are giving some advice to a 43-year hypertensive male with a blood pressure 138/88 about his diet. You tell him to add fiber to his diet by eating:
You are giving some advice to a 30-year asthmatic female. So, you tell her that to prevent asthma attacks she should try and do all the following EXCEPT……
options: Keep surroundings as free as possible from asthma triggers.
Take medications only when he or she feels like it.

questions.stem: What this device is used for?:
Mr Ibrahim 40-Year-Old banker is newly diagnosed with type 2 DM...As his treating physician, you should examine his feet every:
options: There Is no need to examine his feet unless a red flag appears.

questions.stem: You give him how to care for his feet. Which of the following practices is NOT recommended for preventing diabetic foot complications?
options: Inspecting feet daily for cuts, blisters, and sores.
Wearing tight-fitting shoes to protect the feet.
Moisturizing feet daily, avoiding the areas between the toes.

questions.stem: A 30-year-old female patient is pregnant and wants to quit smoking...What is the safest smoking cessation method for her during pregnancy?

A 40-year-old male patient with a history of heart disease. He is concerned about the potential weight gain associated with quitting smoking. Which of the following strategies can help him manage weight gain while quitting smoking?
A 55-year-old male traveler with a history of diabetes and peripheral neuropathy is planning a trip to Southeast Asia. He is concerned about the risk of foot ulcers. What advice would you give him?
options: Skip foot hygiene during the trip.

questions.stem: A 30-year-old male traveler plans to travel widely in sub-Saharan Africa...Which of the following is the most important and appropriate single vaccine you would recommend?
A 35-year-old female traveler is flying from New York to Tokyo...She is concerned about her risk of VTE during the long flight. What advice would you give her?
options: Take a direct flight without layovers.

questions.stem: An 84-year-old female, Mrs. Nabila, presents to your emergency department (ED) after a collapse...When breaking this news to Mrs. Nabila, which communication principle is essential?
options: Using medical jargon to ensure accuracy.
Providing vague information to soften the impact.

questions.stem: You are an oncologist. Mrs. Rasha, a 55-year-old woman, had a breast biopsy a week ago...What is the purpose of using a ‘warning shot’ phrase when delivering bad news?
options: To prepare the listener for difficult information.
